node.title: Corruption watchdog gets former MP Phil Edman's laptop after stripper and sex trip expenses probe
node.alt: A man with a suit and tie sits in a chair in a parliament chamber
node.description: WA's Corruption and Crime Commission finally gets access to more than 500,000 documents from former Liberal MP Phil Edman's laptop as part of a long-running misconduct probe.
node.content:
["The WA Parliament has handed over more than half a million documents from an MP's computer hard drives to the corruption watchdog as part of an investigation into the risks of misconduct.", "The Corruption and Crime Commission (CCC) seized former Liberal MP Phil Edman's laptop and two hard drives\u00a0in 2019 after publishing a damning report into his misuse of parliamentary expenses, which included travel for sex and paying for strippers.", "The report found he also used public money to pay for the berthing fees of his yacht,\u00a0dubbed \"The Prime Minister\".", "The CCC was ordered to hand the laptop back, and a Supreme Court then examined whether Mr Edman's laptop was protected by parliamentary privilege.", "", "
Former MP Phil Edman on a yacht.(Facebook: Phil Edman)
", "It ruled the decision to release the material could only be made by\u00a0 parliament.", "WA Upper House President Alanna\u00a0Clohesy today told parliament more than half a million items had been handed over to the watchdog.", "\"The Procedure and Privileges Committee was able to facilitate, with the assistance of digital forensic staff of the Commission, the production to the Commission in an acceptable format, electronic copies of in excess of 500,000 non privileged items.\"", "She said another 10,000 were isolated and considered to be under privilege, so were not released.", "CCC Commissioner John McKechnie said in September the commission had been informed there was 150GB of deleted data on the laptop.", "
Enough material 'to bury people'
", "The 2019 CCC report\u00a0into the misuse of MP's electoral\u00a0allowances included communication\u00a0between Mr Edman and a then-sitting MP in August 2019:", "He also sent a message to a businessman the following month:", "Mr Edman quit the Liberal Party just hours after the report was released, after then-WA leader Liza Harvey began the process of expelling him.", "At the time, Commissioner McKechnie said the parliamentary allowances represented a serious misconduct risk, worth\u00a0$7.4 million a year.", "Following the Supreme Court's ruling, Mr McKechnie said the commission's\u00a0investigation into allegations of serious misconduct had\u00a0been impeded without access to the non-privileged material on Mr Edman's laptop and two hard drives."]
